contentrichtext.text: {|{{Infobox Ship Begin}} {{Infobox Ship Image |Ship image= |Ship caption= }} {{Infobox Ship Career |Hide header= |Ship country=UK |Ship flag= |Ship name=''London Integrity'' (1955–59, 1973–77)<ref name=SKO71>{{harvnb|Sedgwick||Kinnaird|O'Donoghue1993|p=71}}</ref> RFA ''Bayleaf'' (1959–73)<ref name=SKO71/> |Ship namesake= |Ship owner= |Ship operator= |Ship registry= {{flagicon|UK|civil}} (1955–59, 1973–77)<ref name=SKO71/> {{flagicon|UK|naval-RFA}} |Ship ordered= |Ship awarded= |Ship builder= [[Furness Shipbuilding Company|Furness Shipbuilding Co.]], [[Stockton-on-Tees]], England<ref name=SKO71/> |Ship original cost= |Ship yard number=460<ref name=SKO71/> |Ship way number= |Ship laid down= |Ship launched= 28 October 1954<ref name=SKO71/> |Ship sponsor= |Ship christened= |Ship completed= |Ship acquired= |Ship commissioned= 16 June 1959 and renamed ''Bayleaf''<ref name=SKO71/> |Ship recommissioned= |Ship decommissioned= Returned to her owners in March 1973; name reverted to original<ref name=SKO71/> |Ship in service= |Ship out of service= |Ship renamed=''London Integrity'' (1954-59 and 1973-77)<ref name=SKO71/> |Ship reclassified= |Ship refit= |Ship struck= |Ship reinstated= |Ship homeport=London (with LOF)<ref name=SKO71/> |Ship identification= |Ship motto= |Ship nickname= |Ship honours= |Ship fate= Scrapped in January 1977<ref name=SKO71/> |Ship status= |Ship notes= |Ship badge= }} {{Infobox Ship Characteristics |Hide header= |Header caption= |Ship class= [[Leaf class tanker]] |Ship type= |Ship displacement= {{GRT|12126}}, 6,940 [[Net tonnage|net]], 17,930 [[Deadweight tonnage|deadweight]]<ref name=SKO71/> |Ship length= {{Convert|556|ft|6|in|m|abbr=on}}<ref name=SKO71/> |Ship beam= {{Convert|71|ft|5|in|m|abbr=on}}<ref name=SKO71/> |Ship height= |Ship draught= {{Convert|30|ft|6|in|m|abbr=on}}<ref name=SKO71/> |Ship depth= |Ship decks= |Ship deck clearance= |Ship power= 6800 bhp<ref name=SKO71/> |Ship propulsion=1 × 6-cylinder [[William Doxford & Sons|Doxford]] [[Single- and Double-acting cylinder#Internal combustion engines|single-acting]] [[two-stroke diesel engine]].<ref name=SKO71/> |Ship speed= {{Convert|14|kn|km/h}}<ref name=SKO71/> |Ship range= |Ship endurance= |Ship boats= |Ship capacity= |Ship complement= |Ship notes= [[sister ship]]: [[RFA Brambleleaf (1959)|RFA ''Brambleleaf'' (A81)]] }} |} {{Otherships|RFA Bayleaf}} '''RFA ''Bayleaf'' (A79)''' was a [[Leaf class tanker|Leaf-class]] support tanker of the [[Royal Fleet Auxiliary]], and the second ship to bear the name. ''Bayleaf'' was launched by the [[Furness Shipbuilding Company]] of [[Stockton-on-Tees]].<ref name=SKO71/> She was launched as the civilian ''London Integrity'' for [[London & Overseas Freighters]] in 1954 and completed in 1955.<ref name=SKO71/> She was a [[sister ship]] of [[RFA Brambleleaf (1959)|RFA ''Brambleleaf'' (A81)]] built by the same shipyard for LOF the previous year. She was [[bareboat charter]]ed for the RFA in 1959 and renamed RFA ''Bayleaf''.<ref name=SKO71/> She was returned to her owners in 1973, with whom she traded as the ''London Integrity'' again until the end of 1976.<ref name=SKO71/> On 7 January 1977 she was sold for scrap and on 25 January 1977 she arrived in [[Burriana]] in Spain to be broken up.<ref name=SKO71/> ==References== {{reflist}} ==Sources and further reading== *{{cite book |last1=Sedgwick |first1=Stanley |last2=Kinnaird |first2=Mark |last3=O'Donoghue |first3=K.J. |title=London & Overseas Freighters, 1948-92: A Short History |origyear=1992 |year=1993 |publisher=[[World Ship Society]] |location= |isbn=0-905617-68-1 |ref=harv}} *{{cite book |last1=Sedgwick |first1=Stanley |last2=Sprake |first2=R.F. |title=London & Overseas Freighters Limited 1949-1977 |year=1977 |publisher=[[World Ship Society]] |location= |isbn=0-905617-01-0 |ref=harv}} ==External link== *{{cite web |url=http://www.lof-news.co.uk/History%20&%20Headers%201-2-3/lof1.htm |title=London & Overseas Freighters 1941-97 |author= |date= |work=LOF-News |publisher= |accessdate=29 June 2010}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Bayleaf}} [[Category:1954 ships]] [[Category:Ships of London and Overseas Freighters]] [[Category:Ships of the Royal Fleet Auxiliary]] [[Category:Leaf-class tankers]] {{UK-aux-ship-stub}}
